channel.name: How to Approach a Battleship style game logic in Smart Contract?

messages.content:
How would one go about implementing a battleship style logic in a smart contract. Lets say there's 2 players on a 2d grid of some size, say 5x5, and each player takes up 1 block. Now, they each have two actions, a move and an attack.

This is how I'm thinking about it, and would like some input on if there's a better approach or if I'm on the right track:

All State Fields:
P1 Location: 2dPoint (Hashed)
P1 Attack Location: 2dPoint (Hashed)
P1 Health: Int (Public)

P2 Location: 2dPoint (Hashed)
P2 Attack Location: 2dPoint (Hashed)
P2 Health: Int (Public)

1. p1 and p2 commit to their location
2. p1 and p2 commit to an attack location
3. game node receives actions from all relevant players and signals end of round
4. p1 and p2 reveal their actions (both move and attack) to game node
5. game node runs state transition function for health using revealed locations
6. if attack location matches the current location of opponent, they take damage
7. Loop from 1-6 until one player's health reaches zero.
maybe link the rules you have in mind? I think the traditional battleship game doesn't include any moving. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battleship_(game)
@asimaranov | xRaise x ZkNoid

Hi. Great idea!
Few comments:
A simple hash is not enough as long there are 25 positions, so it is easy check all of them and get the idea where your ship is located. So you need something like secret value, that will help you to hide the real value.
How I see it can be built: 
  1) In the start players generate a secret value and send its hash to the server with a proof, that confirms that you know the secret value and that your position is valid. 
  2) With action there are 2 approaches:
    a) As you suggested throwing some commitments first(also messed with secret value) at first stage, and then reveal real commitment on second stage. This one is good when you need to make simultaneous moves
    b) The second one is just to publish your moves, and other players publish proof of hit(or proof of miss). This one is good for sequential moves
By the way we with @asimaranov | xRaise x ZkNoid are currently building gaming platform https://github.com/ZkNoid/zknoid. So you can reach out to us, and we will be happy to help

Btw we have docs of our next js sdk
https://docs.zknoid.io/docs/game_building
@zkl10 I am already doing it 🙂

It is challenging to have consistent game state storage due to the 8-state limit. 
I am mostly doing a workaround to serialize data for data storage optimization.

sorry, I should have done that. But essentially, it's standard battleship except your "ship" (the player) is a 1x1 entity and can move around the board. But the base logic I'm trying to do would build of off the battleship game logic.

thanks for the clarification! Yes, my game is going to be built with simultaneous player action in mind. I'm glad it sounds like I'm on the right track 🙂
Also yes, I'll definitely be taking a look at zkNoid as well, thanks for the help!
